contentList.content: The shield in the storm. The insurmountable protector. The great one warrior armata. Bond with your shield, and defend your values with unrelenting fervor. You are the juggernaut; you are unstoppable.

Humble and honorable, these juggernauts are guardians of the living. They embrace the wilds of the world for what they are, impressed with their design. For these warriors, there is no greater cause than to protect this wonderful life from what threatens it.
So begins the violence. Ravagers will stop at nothing to draw a battle to its conclusion. They believe in their bloodlust; it guides them to destroy the deserving, defy the odds, and end wars itself.

Some juggernauts train their entire lives with shields, living by the idea that outlasting an enemy in combat is a gauranteed path to victory. The Phalanx does just that, shrugging off mighty blows with their shields endlessly until their opponent eventually tires and is dealt the killing blow. Consummate professionals among their kind, the Phalanx never seem to let up. Even in the biggest and bloodiest battles, they are always the last ones standing.
Utilized to use the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_TauntFoe">Taunt Foe</LSTag> ability.

As an action, you can enter a defensive stance, in which only the most powerful forces can move. You gain advantage on <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag>, and <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> Saving Throws. This lasts until the start of your next turn.

You have gained Advantage on <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag>, and <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> Saving Throws until your next turn.
Your methods are simple; hit that poor unfortunate as hard as you can. Add your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> modifier to your Attack Rolls when not wielding a weapon.
If an enemy makes a melee attack against you and misses, you may use your reaction to deal 1d10+Strength Modifier Bludgeoning damage, knock the target back, and flatten them prone.

Tether your spirit unto your shield. You unlock the ability <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_ShieldSmash">Shield Smash</LSTag> so long as you only have your bonded shield equipped. You cannot be disarmed from your bonded shield; if thrown, it will return to you upon landing. Bonded shields are considered a Magical item.

You are tethered to your shield. The ability <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_ShieldSmash">Shield Smash</LSTag> is available for use. Your shield is now considered magical, cannot be disarmed from you, and will return to you if thrown.
Clash against your foe's frame with your shield.
Your bond with your shield allows you to use it as your primary weapon of choice. This remains active so long as you have a bonded shield equipped, and no weapon in your hand.
Throw your shield at a designated target.
Goad your target into attacking you; the taunted foe will have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> against targets other than yourself.
If you have an ally that is incapacitated near you, add 2d6 Bludgeoning damage to your attack.
Gain one additional hit point per level earned.
you have learned to put your mighty strength to use for offense and control. Your proficiency in Athletics grows, and you have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on Athletics checks.

Your shield strikes crash with the weight of the lives they have taken. Your <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> modifier is added as force damage to <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_ShieldSmash">Shield Smash</LSTag>. Additionally, your strikes now overcome Bludgeoning resistances.
Critical strikes with <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_ShieldSmash">Shield Smash</LSTag> cause a localized explosion that launches nearby enemies backwards.
Critical strikes with <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_ShieldSmash">Shield Smash</LSTag> cause a localized explosion that knocks enemies prone.
